result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey Adonnis Spears

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffrey Adonnis Spears in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Jeffrey Adonnis Spears.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Calendar Call. Defendant appears. Court vacates the stayed warrant. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Forensic evaluation will take place the Wisconsin Forensic Unit, Room 504 of the Safety Building with Dr. Collins on 11/07/2022  at 12:00pm. Case was originally scheduled for arraignment. Court to address Arraignment once competency status is addressed. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeffrey Adonnis Spears not in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent not in court.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Arraignment. Defense counsel is in trial in another branch. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Calendar call scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jeffrey Adonnis Spears appeared by video.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Jeffrey Adonnis Spears.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for arraignment. Defendant is having technical issue. Defendant is needed in-person to do the arraignment. Court adjourns matter for arraignment. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Arraignment scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrey Adonnis Spears in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Jensen. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 11.  Arraignment scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrey Adonnis Spears not in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defendant appeared in person before logging in by zoom, but was not present when the case was called. Attorney Sargent does not appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Jeffrey Adonnis Spears in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jeffrey Adonnis Spears in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeffrey Adonnis Spears appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  AS TO COUNT 2:  Court orally amends incorrect "use of dangerous weapons" enhancer; 939.63(1)(b) to 939.61(1)(a).  State to file an amended complaint.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense reserves entry of plea as to count 2, pending amended complaint.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Cheri L.B.; National Avenue Hotel
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
